benchmark_details.name: Russian-Language Multimodal Dataset for Automatic Summarization of Scientific Papers
benchmark_details.overview: The paper discusses the creation of a multimodal dataset of Russian-language scientific papers and testing of existing language models for the task of automatic text summarization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a dataset for the scientific papers summarization for Russian, covering different domains including technical, humanitarian, and natural sciences.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current version of the dataset covers only 7 scientific domains, but it should be increased to include more diverse areas.

data.source: Collected from three scientific journals covering Economics, History, Information Technologies, Journalism, Law, Linguistics, and Medicine.

methodology.calculation: Metrics like BERTScore and BLEURT calculate the similarity based on pre-trained embeddings, while ROUGE metrics calculate overlapping n-grams.
methodology.interpretation: Values near 1 for metrics indicate better matches.
methodology.baseline_results: The models were evaluated against the reference abstracts from the dataset.
methodology.validation: The quality of generated abstracts was compared with the reference summaries.
